file_content.text: Severe damage to the inner ring of factory defenses, plus those shields are down.
And our losses?
Twenty-eight seasoned Mandalorian warriors. But how they took their foes with them! A thousand mindless, programmed machines lie in the dirt today!
Oh, future generations will sing songs of our brothers' sacrifice against the spawn of production line fifteen alpha...
They're dead. No point mocking them.
Except they're not all dead, because you didn't concentrate your firepower. We'll pay for that tomorrow.
Not bad hunting out there. You're living up to your clan after all.
Not bad hunting out there. You're no Mandalorian, but you pulled your weight.
The factory's damaged, but still functional. The longer we wait, the more droids it will produce for defense.
We must strike again soon.
Agreed, but my people have been at this awhile. You, me, and Khomo can plan in the morning, when the troops are fresh.
Since when is it dishonorable for a Mandalorian to be beaten by a droid? I've seen clans fight machines before.
All that talk about droids...
Not like this. Not for years running.
No disgrace in dying to a droid. No disgrace in falling off a cliff, either, but we're Mandalorians, bred for true combat.
We'll talk in the morning, figure our next move when the troops are fresh.
You sent troops to take the generator down at the same time I was firing on the site? That was your strategy?
Your battle plan was a mess.
Don't pretend you could do better. There are no generals left... just lone warriors trying to survive.
But you want in on the planning? Fine. We regroup in the morning, once the troops are fresh. You earned a voice at the table.
For tonight, we celebrate survival. When's the last time you feasted with your brothers, eh? Hah!
For tonight, we celebrate survival. Show us how an aruetii like you handles Mandalorian drink!
Rough battle. Probably a rough party. Not many outsiders celebrate with us.
I'm looking forward to it, Torian. The Jedi and Mandalorians have spent too much time fighting.
I'm glad to be your guest.
Not many Jedi get to live with Mandalorians, even for a short time. It'd be good to learn from one another.
I'm glad to see your culture.
Maybe. Don't talk like that in front of the guys.
I've spent a lot of time with Sith and spies lately. You may not be SpecForce, but I could use a night trading war stories.
It's good to be with soldiers.
Get your best ready. We're tough to impress.
Not a lot of Mandalorians talk to me without pointing guns. I bet we've got more in common than you'd think.
I'm glad to party with Mandos.
Who said we won't be pointing guns?
The Sith and the Mandalorians are not so different. We both prize struggle and passion.
We have much in common.
Never thought about it that way. Most Sith don't like us.
Nothing can match the debaucheries of Dromund Kaas. But perhaps you can kindle a few memories.
You should see Sith celebrate.
Give me an hour, you'll think I was born Mandalorian. Give me two, you'll think I'd make a good Mandalore.
I'm good at blending in.
You'll fit right in when the bragging starts.
Come on. I don't mind fighting, but it's good to see friends before dying.
If we're fighting together, I should know who you are. Torian, leader of Clan Cadera... what does that mean?
Tell me about yourself first.
Means I'm the last here. Weren't many of us before Zakuul, fewer since.
I don't mind a good fight--struggle, honor, pretty much the same. But I'm tired of friends dying.
I'll pass on that "privilege." I don't drink when there are bodies on the ground and a battle still to win.
I'm in no mood to celebrate.
No point celebrating after everything's calm.
You fought good today, though. For an aruetii.
So. You seen the others?
Everyone but Mako. You know anything?
A few. No word from Blizz or Mako.
A few. No word from Skadge or Mako.
Just Gault. He's still Gault. You?
The rest left early on. Mako and I stuck together awhile. Hunted.
But when Mandalore calls, you answer. Had to leave Mako on Carratos. She can care for herself.
You I'm not leaving. Not ever again.
As if I'd give you a choice?
Same here.
How have you managed? The last five years?
Are you all right?
Fought a lot. Remembered you every day.
Ni kar'tayl gar darasuum.
I love you, too.
Forget the victory party. Let's be alone.
Torian. We've been apart a long while. Maybe it's time you let go.
We need to let each other go.
Cin vhetin. Clean start. If you want.
But this is war, and you still need verde. Warriors. I won't abandon you.
You okay?
You were a blasted good partner, Torian. Haven't seen many like you since I got back.
Better, having you aboard.
I was in carbonite for five years and woke up to this. What do you think?
I'm not sure anymore.
I think that sounds worse than living through it.
Come on. The celebration's waiting.
Let's get to the party.
Burc'ya. So you know: This time I'm sticking with you.
Then we better catch up while we can.
...We send Clan Beroya after the north power station and Fett to the south. That'll weaken the Skytroopers for the final push.
That should work, if your troops are up to the task.
"Power stations." What I'd give for a Republic barracks to bomb...
"Power stations." What I'd give for an Imperial bunker to melt...
Air and sniper units at the Zakuul tactical post will outmaneuver the clans.
Show me the location. I'll handle the droids and give you time to reach the power stations.
You're going to hold off a battalion on your own? You're bold for an outsider, but not bright.
We win this, we march inside next. Good hunting.
